text: HRatq <4y TTTAf yiyarut 7T/Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (s& W407 am {jjhrf AaTT4) 7T7 Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 7-5 W 6, 74z7-10, ETAT, 7 farff-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Green Highway Projects/2017 No.7.4.3/2017 Dated,the 13th July, 2017 (Decision taken on File NoNHAI/GHD/01/01/43/2016/155) Sub: Guidelines for implementing Green Highway Projects. During review of plantations in the current monsoon season, it has been found that major plantation drive needs to be taken up on highway stretches, in order to achieve the vision of green clean and pollution free highways Accordingly following guidelines are issued for urgent compliance: 1 Green Highway Division (GHD) shall act a5 the overall monitoring agency for NHAI Green Highway Projects. It shall also act as technical advisory body which shall oversee the policy, planning, technical specification and best practices. 2_ In all future highway projects under BOT/ HAM or EPC, scope of work shall include median and avenue plantation as per IRC SP: 21: 2009 guidelines for tree plantation and landscaping: 3 Scope of plantation for EPC contracts shall include maintenance and casualty replacement during entire DLP period of contract: further densification additional plantation (beyond the existing scope of BOT HAM projects) may be taken up under change of scope through State Government Agencies (Forest Department Forest Development Corporation etc) 5_ For existing/ongoing EPC contracts, additional plantations beyond the scope of Contract Agreement, shall be taken up under variation order. ROs are hereby authorised to approve Variation Order for additional plantation in EPC Contracts Variation order of additional plantation and its maintenance during DLP shall be sanctioned as per respective Forest schedule of Rate applicable to the project: 47vn NHAI being Any
